issue.title: 更新 Webpack 5

repository.name: koot
repository.description: Koot是基于React和Koa的WEB全栈技术解决方案。

issue.body:
- [x] 利用第一方缓存机制 (https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/6527)
    - [x] _Client_
- [x] 新配置项: `webpackAssetModule`
    - `builtIn` (新默认值)
    - `false` (旧项目默认值)
    - `['png', 'jpg', 'gif', 'svg']`
    - 等 Asset Modules 支持不输出文件的选项 https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/12474#issuecomment-765258062
- [x] [Asset Module](https://webpack.js.org/guides/asset-modules/)
    - 根据配置项更改行为

issue.title: new URL() won't work as I expected upon server side rendering

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

issue.body: # Bug report I'm not sure it's a bug or it is how it works, but let me show it first. **What is the current behavior?** Generally, I want to server-side rendering a page: 1. Bundle `page.js` to `page.bundle.js` with webpack for server side render (I'm setting `target` to `node` and `output.libraryTarget` to `commonjs2`) 2. Call `renderToStaticMarkup` from `react-dom/server` to render the`page.bundle.js` of step 1 into html However, the `page.js` contains code like `const logo = new URL('./logo.svg', import.meta.url)`, now when I require the built `page.bundle.js` and render it with `renderToStaticMarkup`, here's the result of that image: ```html ``` Which obviously won't work in browser. **If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.** Here's a repository I've setup https://github.com/chenxsan/issue-webpack-web-commonjs2, you can see the readme for how to reproduce. **What is the expected behavior?** `new URL()` works alongside server side rendering. **Other relevant information:** webpack version: Node.js version: Operating System: Additional tools:

body:
Is this solved? can we use this now?
        test: /\.png/,
        type: 'asset/resource',
        emitFile: false

issue.title: With Server-side rendering, 'asset/resource' should suppress emitting of the image file (similar to file-loader emitFile=false)

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

issue.body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template or we'll close your issue -->

## Feature request

<!-- Issues that contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->
<!-- Check if this feature needs to be implemented in a plugin or loader instead -->
<!-- If yes: file the issue on the plugin/loader repo -->
<!-- Features related to the development server should be filed on this repo instead -->

**What is the expected behavior?**
When handling images with 'asset/resource' using server-side rendering, we do not want the image file to be emitted, but we do want the image URL to be populated in the HTML in the server bundle. The client bundle can emit the image file.

With file-loader one could do this with the emitFile=false flag, but we cannot do that with Webpack 5 Asset Modules.

'asset/inline' does suppress the output of the image file, but it requires the image to be inlined, which isn't what is desired.

**What is motivation or use case for adding/changing the behavior?**
Webpack 5 Asset Modules deprecated the file-loader. But the emitFile feature of file-loader is not available in Asset Modules. That is a required feature for Server Side Rendering

**How should this be implemented in your opinion?**
Include a flag similar to emitFile with 'asset/resource'

**Are you willing to work on this yourself?**
no

body: Hi, any news on when we can expect this enhancement?

body: You can remove `(\?v=[0-9]\.[0-9]\.[0-9])?` you don't need this

Sorry if my question was unclear. How do I emit file with asset modules? With file-loader we had `emitFile: false`
